intro: Dicymbe amazonica, commonly known as the Amazonian burrbean, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforest canopy. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several small, oval-shaped leaflets. Dicymbe amazonica plays a role in nitrogen fixation, contributing to soil fertility in its natural habitat.
